body: Perhaps we could also provide a method for finding the extent of a tree layout.

This applies to:
- d3.layout.tree
- d3.layout.cluster
- d3.layout.partition

For, d3.layout.partition, fixed size only applies to depth (e.g., 20px per layer); for breadth you are still specifying the size of the overall layout (equivalently, the root node). Although that suggests, for the other layouts, there might be times where you want to fix one of the dimensions but not the other.

I suppose we could define a nodeSize property for these layouts. This would specify the fixed size per-node, rather than the size of the layout. If either _x_ or _y_ was null or undefined, then the node size for the corresponding dimension would be computed automatically from the layout size.
